intro: Cirrhopetalum morotaiense, commonly known as the Morotai star orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the island of Morotai in Indonesia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats, where it thrives in the undergrowth. Its floral structure includes specialized petals and sepals that contribute to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
